attributes.action: King Richard III to be re-interred at Fotheringhay, Northamptonshire
attributes.additional_details:
Richard Plantagenet was born at Fotheringhay Castle in Northamptonshire.
Time for him for him to buried with respect and dignity at the place of his birth.
Northamptonshire bears both the White Rose of York and the Red Rose of Lancaster, symbolising the unity following the Wars of the Roses.
This is the obvious, logical and family compromise solution.
